body_html:
Thanks for bringing this up. We are aware of this issue. Currently in freeze mode the forward op is fused, but backward one is not. As you noticed, the gradient for freeze mode is written in python, composed of other TensorFlow ops, instead of as a fused implementation inside C++ Compute() method.

I think the best thing is to implement it in C++ and add the second-order gradient for it (needed by models like GAN and other second-order optimizers). Re-opened and anyone is welcome to contribute.

Thanks for bringing this up. We are aware of this issue. Currently in freeze mode the forward op is fused, but backward one is not. As you noticed, the gradient for freeze mode is written in python, composed of other TensorFlow ops, instead of as a fused implementation inside C++ Compute() method. 

I think the best thing is to implement it in C++ and add the second-order gradient for it (needed by models like GAN and other second-order optimizers). Re-opened and anyone is welcome to contribute.
